intro: Schiedeella garayana, commonly known as the Garay's schiedea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its upright, woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Schiedeella garayana is often found growing in wet, shaded areas of rainforests. Due to habitat loss and other threats, it is considered a vulnerable species.
